results.name: Square array, read by antidiagonals: form the Euler-Seidel matrix for the sequence {2^k*k!} and then divide column k by 2^k*k!.
comment: This table is closely connected to the constant 1/sqrt(e). The row, column and diagonal entries of this table occur in series acceleration formulas for 1/sqrt(e). For a similar table based on the differences of the sequence {2^k*k!} and related to the constant sqrt(e), see A143410. For other arrays similarly related to constants see A086764 (for e), A143409 (for 1/e), A008288 (for log(2)), A108625 (for zeta(2)) and A143007 (for zeta(3)).
link: D. Dumont, Matrices d'Euler-Seidel, Sem. Loth. Comb. B05c (1981) 59-78.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics Poisson-Charlier polynomial
formula: Recurrence for row n entries: 2*k*T(n,k) = (2*n+2*k-1)*T(n,k-1) + T(n,k-2).
example: The Euler-Seidel matrix for the sequence {2^k*k!} begins
Dividing the k-th column by 2^k*k! gives
maple: with combinat: T := (n, k) -> 1/k!*add(2^j*binomial(n,j)*(k+j)!, j = 0..n): for n from 0 to 9 do seq(T(n, k), k = 0..9) end do;
